Is there a way to affect config without affecting the UI? Seems like maybe this should be enabled on the Hadoop side but not configurable thorough the UI (since the configuration won't actually do anything to WebHDFS on OneFS).
retest this please

Test PASSed.

@dmtucker If we include a config in the mpack, it will be shown in our OneFS service UI. So whether we change HDFS's default or just copy it over, it will be shown.

In this case, we initially included the setting to match our recommendations to admins in order to use Ambari Views. But that's not necessary with the WebHDFS changes in OneFS 8.1.2. Instead of changing the value from `false` to `true`, we should completely remove it. Customers could still add a Custom config to override the HDFS default, but we don't anticipate any need for that. (Only case I can think of is if they disabled WebHDFS in OneFS, they should change the client config to match.)

ambari pull request builder is down, I ran the tests manually

i had some changes:
- move setup.py to root (includes packaging for ambari-common + stacks.utils.RMFTestCase) - also renamed to ambari-python
- subpackages and some resources were not included to the package

with these changes i was able to run python tests against a stack code which was outside of ambari code
@jayush @swapanshridhar @jonathan-hurley @adoroszlai Please review this patch, thanks.

First I simulated an Ambari 2.7.2 upgrade (the new role authorization became created) and then executed integration test with the following results:

User | http://c7401:8080/api/v1/requests | http://c7401:8080/api/v1/clusters/cluster1/requests
------------ | ------------- | -------------
admin| OK | OK
clusterUser | Authorization Failed | OK
viewUser | Authorization Failed | Authorization Failed
Retest this please
